headline: The Lone Ranger would have gone in for the Uvalde children | Letters
sentences: We are kidding ourselves when we complain about $4.619 per gallon for gasoline, then speed 10 to 20 miles over the legal, posted speed limits on the streets and highways and impatiently honk at the car in front of us if that driver doesnt peel out as the light turns green.

Gasoline prices in US surge to fresh record | May 31
Well, at least in President Joe Bidens world with higher gas prices and probably less driving, the good news is that hopefully there will be less vehicle fatalities due to such ridiculously high gas prices.

Frank Moss, Seminole
Reasonable regulations
Dont punish the law-abiding | Letter, May 24
A letter writer equates gun control to one person purposely killing someone with a car, then the government taking away everyones cars.
Ron DeSantis finds the wearing of masks to be COVID theater, but the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has now named numerous counties in Florida to again be in the high infectious category.

Philip Myers, Valrico
How to save on gas
Gasoline prices in US surge to fresh record | May 31
The 24-hour-a-day cable newscasts and newspapers report regularly on surging gasoline prices.
These news outlets should take a break and instead report on speeding automobiles and miles-long traffic jams on interstate highways, streets and even country roads.
I find it hard to believe that the chief officer of the state would not mention this in his travels around Florida on a daily basis.
Both of the men are doing a disservice to the people of this state, especially those with pre-existing conditions.
Oh, and then we stop and buy a 16.9 ounce plastic bottle of water for $2.69, which equals $20.37 per gallon!
Also where is his chief medical person, Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo and why has he not mentioned this?

Children begged for help | May 28
The Lone Ranger would never have hesitated in Uvalde.
Common sense gun laws would similarly ensure implementation of background checks.
The difference is that cars must be licensed, taxed and approved for road use.

Dan Raulerson, Plant City
Mums the COVID word
I know that Gov.

Miklos Lorand, South Pasadena
An upside?
Drivers must be licensed and insured.
What would the Lone Ranger do?
